clinical_study.brief_title: Physiological Assessment of the Endothelium - Circadian Rhythm and Role of the Sympathetic Nervous System
clinical_study.official_title: Studies on the Physiological Meaning of Flow-mediated Constriction, Flow-mediated Dilatation and Vasomotion/Flowmotion: Circadian Variability and Role of the Sympathetic Nervous System.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether interventions aimed at increasing sympathetic tone modify endothelial function measures as assessed by the measurement of flow-mediated dilation (FMD) and constriction (FMC). The investigators hypothesize that the three interventions under study will increase FMC while causing a blunting in FMD.
Further, the investigators plan to study the circadian variability of FMC and FMD. The investigators hypothesize a peak of FMD in the late hours of the day and a peak of FMC in the early hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in FMD in response to sympathetic activation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in FMD before versus 1 Minute after begin of intervention
primary_outcome.description: Flow-mediated dilation will be measured at rest and during each of the interventions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in FMC during sympathetic activation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in FMC before versus 1 minute after begin of each intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Flow-mediated constriction induced by each of the interventions.

arm_group.description: Subjects will undergo endothelial function assessment at rest and, after a 45 minutes pause, 1 minute after begin of myogenic activation
Subjects will undergo endothelial function assessment at rest and, after a 45 minutes pause, 1 minute after begin of cold pressure test
Subjects will undergo endothelial function assessment at rest and, after a 45 minutes pause, 1 minute after begin of mental stress
Control visit - no intervention performed - subjects will undergo endothelial function measurement twice at a distance of 45 minutes

intervention.description: Subjects will be asked to perform complex mathematic operations at a very fast pace
A pneumatic cuff will be inflated to suprasystolic pressure around both thighs and the subjects will be asked to perform plantar flexion exercises.
A hand will be placed in ice-cold water.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy volunteers with no cardiovascular risk factor, no current disease, normal laboratory parameters and ECG.
Exclusion Criteria:
- any active disease
